title: Congratulating the Victor High School Marching Blue Devils Band upon the occasion of placing 4th in the USSBA Championships
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  the Victor High School Marching
Blue Devils Band and Director Eric Everhart upon the occasion of placing
4th in the United States Scholastic Band Association Championships

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize the dedi-
cation and commitment of our young  people  who  distinguish  themselves
through excellence in musical competition; and
  WHEREAS,  Music  competition  provides  an opportunity for students to
exhibit their practical skills to an audience,  thereby  giving  them  a
sense of pride in their hard work and efforts; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and fully in accord with its long-
standing  traditions,  it  is  the  intent  of  this Legislative Body to
congratulate the Victor High School Marching Blue Devils Band  upon  the
occasion of placing 4th in the United States Scholastic Band Association
Championships; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Victor  Marching  Blue  Devils  ended a successful 2010
season, with a New York State Championship and a fourth place finish  at
the United States Scholastic Band Association (USSBA) Championships held
in  Annapolis, Maryland on November 6, 2010; the Marching Blue Devils in
their third year in the National Class, placed fourth out of 16 bands in
their division; at  the  USSBA  Championships,  a  total  of  100  bands
competed in all divisions from 12 states; and
  WHEREAS, The Marching Blue Devils is comprised of over 100 students in
grades  seven  through  12, and performed their program, Axiomata Motus:
The Principles of Motion; and
  WHEREAS, On October 31, 2010, the Victor  Marching  Blue  Devils  were
named  National  Class  Champions  with a score of 97.05 at the New York
State Field Band Conference Championships at the Syracuse Carrier  Dome;
and
  WHEREAS, The members of the 2010 Marching Blue Devils Band have proven
themselves to be an unbeatable combination of talents, reflecting favor-
ably on Victor High School; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Band's  outstanding  performance  has  clearly  made  a
contribution to the spirit of excellence which is a tradition of  Victor
High School; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate the members, Nicole Barry, Kristin Barry, Kaitlyn  Benwitz,
Sam  Benwitz, Joseph Bills, Whitney Bishop, Morgan Bishop, Lindsey Brad-
ley, Emily Brown, Kristian Brown,  Randy  Bush,  Jay  Butcher,  Ashleigh
Carey,  Emily  Carrozzi,  Alyssa Catholdi, Nick Centonze, Mitchell Chan,
Brittany Clark, Lindsay Clark, Justin  Dake,  Ashton  Davenport,  Olivia
DeCarlo,  Jenna  DeFranco,  Austin  Drabek,  Christian  Drew, Jake Drew,
Katherine Eames, Michelle Eames, Christina Eames, Lindsay  Ernst,  Aleta
Everhart,  Logan  Everhart,  Mason  Everhart,  Brianna Farrell, Julianna
Fisher,  Marissa  Gallo,  Edward  Gharzouzi,  Deanna  Giardino,  Candace
Gonnella,  Cameron  Goodman,  Melanie Gydesen, Alan Harding, Danny Hawk,
Emily Hawk, Jennifer Heltz,  Shealynn  Hilliard,  Lesley  Hogan,  Taylor
Holmes, JoAnna Holroyd, Victoria Lanzillo, Kevin Lavery, Geena Lawatsch,
Laurel  Lehman,  Maggie  Limbeck,  Brent  Lindsay, Emily Mansfield, Luke
Martin, Emily McIntyre, Luke McIntyer, Brianna Merlo, Ryan Merlo,  David
Montmarquet, Paige Morrell, Zach Mosher, Alayna Murphy, Aaron Natarelli,
Declan O'Brien, Cody O'Connor, Ellen Patridge, Cody Paul, Anthony Perdi-
gao,  Beverly Petilli, Connor Petilli, Michelle Petilli, Anita Polvinen,
Kailyn Ricigliano, Alex Robinson, Julia  Rodriguez,  Lindy  Rohr,  Jenny
Rowan,  Madison  Royal, Nate Samoriski, Alysia Schantz, Kristen Schantz,
Dan Shawe, Hali Shepard, Megan Shepard, Chris Snyder,  Carolyn  Spitzer,
Kathryn  Sprague,  Laura  Sprague,  Nathan Sprague, Sean Steele, Kristen

Stewart, Hannah Thumm, Taylor  Triou,  Amanda  Wagner,  Katie  Williams,
Gregory  Williamson, Erin Whipple, Melissa Whipple, Emma Wisotzke, Chel-
sie Yourch, and Ryan Yourch; the staff: Mike Heaney, Ted  Mascari,  Mary
Burke,  Kelly  Moser-Vogler,  Lesley  Rider, Shane Startzel, Joe Taylor,
Patsy Van Kirk, Jonathan Ytreberg, Sara Zuhlsdorf,  and  Kiah  Everhart;
Assistant  Director Mark Rider, and Director Eric Everhart of the Victor
High School Marching Blue Devils Band upon the occasion of  placing  4th
in  the  United States Scholastic Band Association Championships; and be
it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the members of the 2010  Victor  High  School  Marching  Blue
Devils Band, the staff, and to the aforementioned Directors.
